sen.j: 石川 元光（いしかわ もとみつ、生年不詳 - 康和元年9月8日 (旧暦)（1099年9月24日））は、平安時代後期の武将。
sen.e: Motomitsu ISHIKAWA (year of birth unknown - September 24, 1099) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the late Heian period.
Motomitsu ISHIKAWA (year of birth unknown - September 24, 1099) was a busho (Japanese military commander) who lived during the late Heian period.
Motomitsu ISHIKAWA (year of birth unknown - September 24, 1099) was a busho (Japanese military commander) who lived during the late Heian period.

sen.j: 大和源氏の流れを汲む陸奥石川氏3代目当主。
sen.e: He was the third family head of the Mutsu Ishikawa clan descended from the Yamato-Genji (Minamoto clan).
He was the third family head of the Mutsu Ishikawa family descended from the Yamato-Genji (Minamoto clan).
sen.cmt: この場合の石川氏は当主の説明なのでclanをfamilyに修正しました。
sen.e: He was the third family head of the Mutsu Ishikawa family descended from the Yamato-Genji (Minamoto clan).
He was the third son of MINAMOTO no Arimitsu.
He was the third son of MINAMOTO no Arimitsu.
He was the third son of MINAMOTO no Arimitsu.

sen.j: 子に、石川光忠、石川光義、石川季康、石川政光、石川忠重、石川義基。
sen.e: His sons were 石川光忠,Mitsuyoshi ISHIKAWA, 石川季康, 石川政光, 石川忠重, and石川義基.
His sons included Mitsutada ISHIKAWA, Mitsuyoshi ISHIKAWA, Sueyasu ISHIKAWA, Masamitsu ISHIKAWA, Tadashige ISHIKAWA, and Yoshimoto ISHIKAWA.
sen.cmt: 他にも息子がいる可能性を考えincludeにしました。
sen.e: His sons included Mitsutada ISHIKAWA, Mitsuyoshi ISHIKAWA, Sueyasu ISHIKAWA, Masamitsu ISHIKAWA, Tadashige ISHIKAWA, and Yoshimoto ISHIKAWA.

sen.j: 従四位下治部大輔、従四位上大膳大夫。
sen.e: He was appointed as Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade), Jibu taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of theMinistry of the Civil Administration) as well as Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade), Daizen no daibu (Master of the Palace Table).

His official rank was Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade), Jibu taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of the Civil Administration), and later Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade), Daizen no daibu (Master of the Palace Table).
sen.cmt: このセルは階位を説明しているのでappointを変更しました。従四位上下は同時ではないと考え、「後に」という意味になるように書き換えました。theMinistry→the Ministry
sen.e: His official rank was Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade), Jibu taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of the Civil Administration), and later Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade), Daizen no daibu (Master of the Palace Table).

sen.j: 夫人は下野国薬師寺 (下野市)城主舘野将文の娘。
sen.e: His wife was a daughter of 舘野将文, the lord of a castle Yakushi-ji Temple of Shimotsuke Province (Shimotsuke City).
His wife was the daughter of Masafumi TATENO, the lord of Yakushiji-jo Castle of Shimotsuke Province (now Shimotsuke City).
sen.cmt: 「舘野将文」の読み方が不明です。薬師寺城は薬師寺氏が建てた城なのでtempleは必要ないと考えました。娘の数が不明なので冠詞をtheに換えました。現下野市としました。
sen.e: His wife was the daughter of Masafumi TATENO, the lord of Yakushiji-jo Castle of Shimotsuke Province (now Shimotsuke City).

sen.j: 基光と改名するが、父有光の隠居によって第3代当主となり従四位下治部大輔に任ぜられたことで元光の名に復す。
sen.e: He renamed to Motomitsu (基光), and then, after he became the third load due to his father's retirement, and appointed as Jushiinoge, Jibu taifu, he changed his name again back to Motomitsu (元光).

He once changed the Chinese characters applied to his name Motomitsu to "基光," but returned to the original "元光" after becoming the third family head succeeding his retired father, as well as being appointed to Jushiinoge, Jibu taifu.
sen.cmt: わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: He once changed the Chinese characters applied to his name Motomitsu to "基光," but returned to the original "元光" after becoming the third family head succeeding his retired father, as well as being appointed to Jushiinoge, Jibu taifu.

sen.j: 寛治元年（1087年）、源義家が清原武衡を攻めると、兵を率いて参陣して出羽国金沢柵を攻める。
sen.e: In 1087 when MINAMOTO no Yoshiie attacked KIYOHARA no Takehira, he led an army to join the war and attacked Dewa Province.
When MINAMOTO no Yoshiie attacked KIYOHARA no Takehira in 1087, he joined the war on the Minamoto side with his troops and attacked Kanazawa-jo Castle, Dewa Province.
sen.cmt: 「金沢柵」が訳漏れでしたので訳を入れました。「兵を率いて参陣して」は参陣を中心に書き換えました。
sen.e: When MINAMOTO no Yoshiie attacked KIYOHARA no Takehira in 1087, he joined the war on the Minamoto side with his troops and attacked Kanazawa-jo Castle, Dewa Province.

sen.j: その時の軍功により、田川郡 (羽前国)を与えられる。
sen.e: For his distinguished service in the war, he was given Tagawa District (Uzen province).
For his distinguished service in the war, he was given Tagawa District (Uzen province).
For his distinguished service in the war, he was given Tagawa District (Uzen province).

sen.j: 嘉保2年（1095年）、一族とともに上洛して自らは従四位上大膳大夫、
sen.e: In 1095, he came up to Kyoto with his family and appointed as Jushiijo, Daizen no daibu, Mitsusuke Odera, his paternal half brother as Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Totomi no kami (the Governor of Totomi Province), Kofu YABUKI, his younger brother as Jugoinoge, Shimotsuke no kami (the governer of Shimotsuke Province), Mitsufusa NAMETSU, his younger brother as Jugoinoge, governor of Iwami Province.
Coming up to Kyoto with his clan in 1095, he was appointed as Jushiijo, Daizen no daibu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。この場合の一族は郎党も含めるのでfamilyをclanと修正しました。
sen.e: Coming up to Kyoto with his clan in 1095, he was appointed as Jushiijo, Daizen no daibu.

sen.j: 異母兄・大寺光祐は従五位下遠江守、弟・矢吹光孚は従五位下下野守、奈目津光房は従五位下石見守にそれぞれ任じられる。
sen.e: Meanwhile, Mitsusuke Odera, Motomitsu's paternal half brother was appointed as Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Totomi no kami (the Governor of Totomi Province), Motomitsu's younger brother Kofu YABUKI was appointed as Jugoinoge, Shimotsuke no kami (the governor of Shimotsuke Province), and Motomitsu's younger brother Mitsufusa NAMETSU was appointed as Jugoinoge, Iwami no kami (the governor of Iwami Province).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。彼の弟、異母兄に一様にhisを使うと誰のなのか登場人物が多く不明瞭なため、「元光の」としました。石見守の記載を下野守とあわせました。下野守の説明中のgovernorのスペルミスを訂正しました。
sen.e: Meanwhile, Mitsusuke Odera, Motomitsu's paternal half brother was appointed as Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Totomi no kami (the Governor of Totomi Province), Motomitsu's younger brother Kofu YABUKI was appointed as Jugoinoge, Shimotsuke no kami (the governor of Shimotsuke Province), and Motomitsu's younger brother Mitsufusa NAMETSU was appointed as Jugoinoge, Iwami no kami (the governor of Iwami Province).
